intro: Lessingia bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with hairy stems and small, alternate leaves. Its flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Lessingia bicolor is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
